definition: to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)

sentences.english: The foolish people were clamouring for war .
sentences.chinese: 愚昧的人叫囂着要求打仗。

sentences.english: The crowd hooted and jeered at the speaker.
sentences.chinese: 羣衆向那演講人發出輕蔑的叫囂和嘲笑。

sentences.english: They hooted the professors off the stage.
sentences.chinese: 他們叫囂把教授們轟下舞臺。

sentences.english: You've breached the decorum of my courtroomwith all this hooting.
sentences.chinese: 你的這種叫囂違反了本法庭的禮儀。

sentences.english: Overseas clamoring for "rare-earth diplomacy" those intentions all too clear.
sentences.chinese: 海外叫囂“稀土外交”者，用心昭然若揭。

sentences.english: The students clamored to see the new president.
sentences.chinese: 學生們叫囂着要求見新校長。

sentences.english: He was interrupted in a speech by clamors of disapprobation.
sentences.chinese: 他的演說因反對的叫囂聲而中斷。

sentences.english: The southest buffoon is still clamouring to depart form China.
sentences.chinese: 東南小丑們還在叫囂着要獨立。

sentences.english: In the South, there is open talk of “liberating” the North.
sentences.chinese: 而南朝鮮的“解放北方”的叫囂，也是甚囂塵上。

sentences.english: They are always clamouring for war.
sentences.chinese: 他們總是不斷髮出戰爭叫囂。

sentences.english: It seems that the Philippines have stopped clamoring for sovereignty over the Huangyan Island.
sentences.chinese: 菲律賓好像最近不再叫囂黃巖島是它的領土了。

sentences.english: Advoctogether withes vociferously support one position or the other .
sentences.chinese: 首倡者叫囂着支持其中的一個立場。

definition: to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
